title: Import
text: vignette gives overview importing files downstream analysis mpwR.

title: Import
text: Importing output files software can easily performed prepare_mpwR. Please put output files one folder follow guidelines naming files. files/subfolders allowed.

title: Import
text: software output files need named according simple rules.

title: Import
text: Please use following suffixes corresponding software: *.tsv - _Report evidence.txt - _evidence peptides.txt - _peptides proteinGroups.txt - _proteinGroups *.tsv - _Report PSMs.txt - _PSMs PeptideGroups.txt - _PeptideGroups Proteins.txt - _Proteins ProteinGroups.txt - _ProteinGroups Note suffixes MaxQuant ProteomeDiscoverer can used .

title: Import
text: Please use prefix analysis respective software output file(s). analysis needs unique identifier. Examples: WorkflowA1_Report.tsv WorkflowA2_evidence.txt WorkflowA2_peptide.txt WorkflowA2_proteinGroups.txt WorkflowA3_Report.tsv WorkflowA4_PSMs.txt WorkflowA4_PeptideGroups.txt WorkflowA4_Proteins.txt WorkflowA4_ProteinGroups.txt

title: Import
text: Solution: Please use unique name (prefix) respective output file(s). E.g. used…: WorkflowA1_Report.tsv WorkflowA1_evidence.txt WorkflowA1_peptide.txt WorkflowA1_proteinGroups.txt … error message displayed. solution, example add used software name: WorkflowA1_Spectronaut_Report.tsv WorkflowA1_MQ_evidence.txt WorkflowA1_MQ_peptide.txt WorkflowA1_MQ_proteinGroups.txt

title: Import
text: Error prepare_input(ordered_files[[]][[“data”]][[“DIA-NN”]], software = “DIA-NN”) : required columns present submitted data. example DIA-NN. Similar messages software tools. Please make sure include required columns used software. Details vignette Requirements.

title: Output Explanations
text: vignette showcases plot outputs generated mpwR provides explanations user.

title: Output Explanations
text: overview individual plots apply absolute relative comparisons. examples, absolute numbers used. detail, three workflows compared protein-level based three replicate runs.

title: Requirements
text: vignette gives overview requirements mpwR. outputs following software applications supported: Spectronaut MaxQuant DIA-NN Proteome Discoverer

title: Requirements
text: following columns required: R.FileName PG.ProteinGroups PG.Quantity PEP.StrippedSequence PEP.NrOfMissedCleavages PEP.Quantity EG.Identified EG.ModifiedPeptide EG.PrecursorId EG.ApexRT FG.Charge

title: Requirements
text: following files respective columns required: Raw file Proteins Sequence Missed cleavages Retention time Modified sequence Charge Protein group IDs Peptide ID Potential contaminant Reverse Intensity Sequence Missed cleavages Last amino acid Amino acid Intensity column(s) LFQ intensity column(s) Protein group IDs Evidence IDs Potential contaminant Reverse ProteinIDs Majority protein IDs Peptide counts () Intensity column(s) LFQ intensity column(s) id Peptide IDs Evidence IDs Potential contaminant Reverse identified site

title: Requirements
text: following columns required: Protein.Group Precursor.Id Run Stripped.Sequence Protein.Ids Modified.Sequence PG.MaxLFQ Precursor.Charge RT Precursor.Id Precursor.Quantity PG.Q.Value Q.Value

title: Requirements
text: Please enable R-friendly headers exporting files. following files respective columns required: Confidence Spectrum File Number Missed Cleavages Protein Accessions Annotated Sequence Modifications Charge RT min Number Protein Groups Number Proteins Number PSMs Confidence Sequence Modifications Number Missed Cleavages Found Sample column(s) (Required: Data Distributions node consensus workflow; set Show Found Samples parameter True) Proteins Unique Sequence ID Protein FDR Confidence Combined Accession Description Found Sample column(s) (Required: Data Distributions node consensus workflow; set Show Found Samples parameter True) Protein Groups Protein Group ID Group Description Number Proteins Number Unique Peptides Found Sample column(s) (Required: Data Distributions node consensus workflow; set Show Found Samples parameter True)

what: Data Analysis Report for software comparison.
title: Use case - Software Comparison
text: Plasma samples prepared analyzed triplicate MS runs Q Exactive HF instrument DDA DIA mode. vignette showcase example comparing proteomic software. DDA data analyzed MaxQuant (MQ) ProteomeDiscoverer (PD). DIA data analyzed Spectronaut DIA-NN.

title: Use case - Software Comparison
text: metrics summarized via radar charts. showcase examples radar charts number IDs, data completeness precision metrics shown. Note, radar charts usually interactive. Due size requirements generating pkgdown vignette, pictures radar charts included.

title: Workflow
text: vignette workflow template data import downstream analysis mpwR including highlighting number identifications, data completeness, quantitative retention time precision etc. demonstrates significant steps showcases functions applicability.

title: Workflow
code: library(mpwR) library(flowTraceR) library(magrittr) library(dplyr) library(tidyr) library(stringr) library(tibble) library(ggplot2) library(flextable)

title: Workflow
text: Importing output files software can performed prepare_mpwR. Please put output files one folder follow guidelines naming files. files/subfolders allowed. Details provided vignette Import.

title: Workflow
text: examples provided explore workflow create_example.

title: Workflow
text: number identifications can determined get_ID_Report.   analysis ID Report generated stored list. ID Report entry can easily accessed: Analysis Run ProteinGroup.IDs Protein.IDs Peptide.IDs Precursor.IDs DIA-NN R01 5 5 5 5 DIA-NN R02 5 5 5 5

title: Workflow
text: ID Report can plotted plot_ID_barplot precursor- proteingroup-level. generated barplots stored list.   individual barplots can easily accessed:

title: Workflow
text: visual summary boxplot can generated plot_ID_boxplot.

title: Workflow
text: Data Completeness can determined get_DC_Report absolute numbers percentage.   analysis DC Report generated stored list. DC Report entry can easily accessed: Analysis Nr.Missing.Values Precursor.IDs Peptide.IDs Protein.IDs ProteinGroup.IDs Profile DIA-NN 1 0 0 4 2 unique DIA-NN 0 5 5 3 4 complete
code: DC_Reports <- get_DC_Report(input_list = files, metric = "absolute") DC_Reports_perc <- get_DC_Report(input_list = files, metric = "percentage") flextable::flextable(DC_Reports[["DIA-NN"]])

title: Workflow
text: DC Report can plotted plot_DC_barplot precursor- proteingroup-level. generated barplots stored list.   individual barplots can easily accessed:
code: DC_Barplots <- plot_DC_barplot(input_list = DC_Reports, level = "ProteinGroup.IDs", label = "absolute") DC_Barplots[["DIA-NN"]]

title: Workflow
text: visual summary stacked barplot can generated plot_DC_stacked_barplot.

title: Workflow
text: report Missed Cleavages can generated get_MC_Report absolute numbers percentage.   analysis MC Report generated stored list. MC Report entry can easily accessed: Analysis Missed.Cleavage mc_count Spectronaut 0 1 Spectronaut 1 1 Spectronaut 2 1 Spectronaut 3 1
code: MC_Reports <- get_MC_Report(input_list = files, metric = "absolute") MC_Reports_perc <- get_MC_Report(input_list = files, metric = "percentage") flextable::flextable(MC_Reports[["Spectronaut"]])

title: Workflow
text: MC Report can plotted plot_MC_barplot precursor- proteingroup-level. generated barplots stored list.   individual barplots can easily accessed:

title: Workflow
text: visual summary stacked barplot can generated plot_MC_stacked_barplot.

title: Workflow
text: coefficient variation (CV) can calculated get_CV_RT. complete profiles used.

title: Workflow
text: visual summary density plot analyses can accessed via plot_CV_density.

title: Workflow
text: CV can calculated get_CV_LFQ_pep. complete profiles used.
code: CV_LFQ_Pep <- get_CV_LFQ_pep(input_list = files) #> For DIA-NN no quantitative LFQ data on peptide-level. #> For PD no quantitative LFQ data on peptide-level.

title: Workflow
text: visual summary density plot analyses can accessed via plot_CV_density.

title: Workflow
text: CV can calculated get_CV_LFQ_pg. complete profiles used.
code: CV_LFQ_PG <- get_CV_LFQ_pg(input_list = files) #> For PD no quantitative LFQ data on proteingroup-level.

title: Workflow
text: visual summary density plot analyses can accessed via plot_CV_density.

title: Workflow
text: Common identifications intersections analyses can highlighted.

title: Workflow
text: Use get_Upset_list prepare Upset plotting.

title: Workflow
text: Upset plot can generated plot_Upset.

title: Workflow
text: Functions package flowTraceR incorporated mpwR inter-software comparisons. Software outputs standardized easily comparable.

title: Workflow
text: Without standardizing precursor-level information, software outputs form software-dependent cluster.

title: Workflow
text: enabling flowTraceR precursor-level information standardized common identifications can inferred.
code: get_Upset_list(input_list = files, level = "Peptide.IDs", flowTraceR = TRUE) %>% #prepare Upset   plot_Upset(label = "Peptide.IDs") #plot #> flowTraceR not available for generic input. No conversion applied for position 5 in input_list.

title: Workflow
text: mpwR offers functions summarize downstream analysis.

title: Workflow
text: summary report can generated get_summary_Report.

title: Workflow
text: visual summary radar chart analyses can accessed via plot_radarchart.

title: Workflow
text: highlight individual categories, generated summary report can easily adjusted used plotting.
code: #Focus on Data Completeness Summary_Report %>%   dplyr::select(Analysis, contains("Full")) %>% #Analysis column and at least one category column is required   plot_radarchart()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Oliver Kardell. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kardell O (2025). mpwR: Standardized Comparison Workflows Mass Spectrometry-Based Bottom-Proteomics. R package version 0.1.5.1.
code: @Manual{,   title = {mpwR: Standardized Comparison of Workflows in Mass Spectrometry-Based Bottom-Up Proteomics},   author = {Oliver Kardell},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.5.1}, }

what: Standardized Comparison of Workflows in Mass Spectrometry-Based Bottom-Up Proteomics
title: Standardized Comparison of Workflows in Mass Spectrometry-Based Bottom-Up Proteomics
text: mpwR [ɪmˈpaʊə(r)] offers systematic approach comparing proteomic workflows empowers researcher effortlessly access valuable information identifications, data completeness, quantitative precision, performance indicators across unlimited number analyses multiple software tools. can used analyze label-free mass spectrometry-based experiments data-dependent data-independent spectral acquisition.

title: Standardized Comparison of Workflows in Mass Spectrometry-Based Bottom-Up Proteomics
text: functions mpwR provide great foundation generate customized reports e.g. RMarkdown build shiny apps/dashboards downstream data analysis. example shiny dashboard available .

title: Standardized Comparison of Workflows in Mass Spectrometry-Based Bottom-Up Proteomics
text: Install development version GitHub using devtools package using following commands:
code: # install.packages("devtools") #remove "#" if you do not have devtools package installed yet devtools::install_github("OKdll/mpwR", dependencies = TRUE) # use dependencies TRUE to install all required packages for mpwR

title: Standardized Comparison of Workflows in Mass Spectrometry-Based Bottom-Up Proteomics
text: input standard outputs ProteomeDiscoverer, Spectronaut, DIA-NN MaxQuant supported mpwR. Details requirements listed vignette Requirements.

title: Create example data — create_example
text: Example data ProteomeDiscoverer, Spectronaut, DIA-NN MaxQuant.

title: Create example data — create_example
text: function returns list example data. list entry filename software information well corresponding data set.

title: Create example data — create_example
text: Example data generated software testing functions mpwR. column created randomized fashion. Connections columns necessarily valid. E.g. column Precursor Charges might reflect charges Precuror.IDs column.

title: Create example data — create_example
text: Oliver Kardell

title: Peptide-level: Quantitative precision — get_CV_LFQ_pep
text: Calculate quantitative precision peptide-level

title: Peptide-level: Quantitative precision — get_CV_LFQ_pep
text: input_list list data frames respective quantitative peptide information.

title: Peptide-level: Quantitative precision — get_CV_LFQ_pep
text: function returns original submitted data input_list including new output column: CV_Peptide_LFQ_mpwR - coefficient variation percentage.

title: Peptide-level: Quantitative precision — get_CV_LFQ_pep
text: submitted data coefficient variation calculated peptide-level LFQ intensities. full profiles included.

title: Peptide-level: Quantitative precision — get_CV_LFQ_pep
text: Oliver Kardell

title: Peptide-level: Quantitative precision — get_CV_LFQ_pep
code: # Load libraries library(stringr) library(magrittr) library(tibble)  # Example data set.seed(123) data <- list(   Spectronaut = list(      filename = "C",      software = "Spectronaut",      data = list(         "Spectronaut" = tibble::tibble(            Run_mpwR = rep(c("A","B"), times = 5),            Precursor.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A2", "A3", "B2", "B3", "C1"), each = 2),            Stripped.Sequence_mpwR = rep(c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E"), each = 2),            Peptide.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E"), each = 2),            ProteinGroup.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E"), each = 2),            Retention.time_mpwR = sample(1:20, 10),            Peptide_LFQ_mpwR = sample(1:30, 10),            ProteinGroup_LFQ_mpwR = sample(1:30, 10))      )   ) )  # Result output <- get_CV_LFQ_pep(   input_list = data )

title: Proteingroup-level: Quantitative precision — get_CV_LFQ_pg
text: Calculate quantitative precision proteingroup-level

title: Proteingroup-level: Quantitative precision — get_CV_LFQ_pg
text: input_list list data frames respective quantitative proteingroup information.

title: Proteingroup-level: Quantitative precision — get_CV_LFQ_pg
text: function returns original submitted data input_list including new output column: CV_ProteinGroup_LFQ_mpwR - coefficient variation percentage.

title: Proteingroup-level: Quantitative precision — get_CV_LFQ_pg
text: submitted data coefficient variation calculated proteingroup-level LFQ intensities. full profiles included.

title: Proteingroup-level: Quantitative precision — get_CV_LFQ_pg
text: Oliver Kardell

title: Proteingroup-level: Quantitative precision — get_CV_LFQ_pg
code: # Load libraries library(stringr) library(magrittr) library(tibble)  # Example data set.seed(123) data <- list(   Spectronaut = list(      filename = "C",      software = "Spectronaut",      data = list(         "Spectronaut" = tibble::tibble(            Run_mpwR = rep(c("A","B"), times = 5),            Precursor.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A2", "A3", "B2", "B3", "C1"), each = 2),            Peptide.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E"), each = 2),            ProteinGroup.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E"), each = 2),            Retention.time_mpwR = sample(1:20, 10),            Peptide_LFQ_mpwR = sample(1:30, 10),            ProteinGroup_LFQ_mpwR = sample(1:30, 10))      )   ) )  # Result output <- get_CV_LFQ_pg(   input_list = data )

title: Retention time precision — get_CV_RT
text: Calculate retention time precision

title: Retention time precision — get_CV_RT
text: input_list list data frames respective retention time information.

title: Retention time precision — get_CV_RT
text: function returns original submitted data input_list including new output column: CV_Retention.time_mpwR - coefficient variation percentage.

title: Retention time precision — get_CV_RT
text: submitted data coefficient variation calculated precursor-level retention time. full profiles included.

title: Retention time precision — get_CV_RT
text: Oliver Kardell

title: Retention time precision — get_CV_RT
code: # Load libraries library(tibble)  # Example data set.seed(123) data <- list(   Spectronaut = list(      filename = "C",      software = "Spectronaut",      data = list(         "Spectronaut" = tibble::tibble(            Run_mpwR = rep(c("A","B"), times = 5),            Precursor.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A2", "A3", "B2", "B3", "C1"), each = 2),            Peptide.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E"), each = 2),            ProteinGroup.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E"), each = 2),            Retention.time_mpwR = sample(1:20, 10),            Peptide_LFQ_mpwR = sample(1:30, 10),            ProteinGroup_LFQ_mpwR = sample(1:30, 10))      )   ) )  # Result output <- get_CV_RT(   input_list = data )

title: Data Completeness Report — get_DC_Report
text: Generates data completeness report precursor proteingroup-level

title: Data Completeness Report — get_DC_Report
text: input_list list data frames respective level information. metric "absolute" absolute numbers "percentage" displaying percentages. Default absolute.

title: Data Completeness Report — get_DC_Report
text: function returns list. analysis respective data frame including missing value information per level stored generated list. Analysis - analysis name. Nr.Missing.Values - number missing values. Precursor.IDs - number precursor identification per missing value entry - absolute percentage. Peptide.IDs - number peptide identification per missing value entry - absolute percentage. Protein.IDs - number protein identification per missing value entry - absolute percentage. ProteinGroup.IDs - number proteingroup identification per missing value entry - absolute percentage. Profile - categorical entries: "unique", "sparse", "shared least 50%" "complete".

title: Data Completeness Report — get_DC_Report
text: submitted data data completeness report generated highlighting missing values precursor-, peptide-, protein- proteingroup-level.

title: Data Completeness Report — get_DC_Report
text: Oliver Kardell

title: Data Completeness Report — get_DC_Report
code: # Load libraries library(tibble) library(stringr)  # Example data data <- list( DIANN = list(   filename = "B",   software = "DIA-NN",   data = list(      "DIA-NN" = tibble::tibble(         Run_mpwR = rep(c("A","B"), times = 10),         Precursor.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A2", "A3", "B2", "B3", "C1"), each = 4),         Protein.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A2", "A3", "B2", "B3", "C1"), each = 4),         Peptide.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A", "A", "B", "B", "C"), each = 4),         ProteinGroup.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A2", "A3", "B2", "B3", "C1"), each = 4)      )   ) ) )  # Result output <- get_DC_Report(   input_list = data,   metric = "absolute" )

title: Report for identifications — get_ID_Report
text: Generates report identifications

title: Report for identifications — get_ID_Report
text: input_list list data frames respective level information.

title: Report for identifications — get_ID_Report
text: function returns list. analysis respective data frame including number identifications per run stored generated list. Analysis - analysis name. Run - run information. Precursor.IDs - number precursor identification. Peptide.IDs - number peptide identification. Protein.IDs - number protein identification. ProteinGroup.IDs - number proteingroup identification.

title: Report for identifications — get_ID_Report
text: submitted data report achieved number identifications generated precursor-, peptide-, protein- proteingroup-level.

title: Report for identifications — get_ID_Report
text: Oliver Kardell

title: Report for identifications — get_ID_Report
code: # Load libraries library(tibble) library(stringr)  # Example data data <- list( DIANN = list(   filename = "B",   software = "DIA-NN",   data = list(      "DIA-NN" = tibble::tibble(         Run_mpwR = rep(c("A","B"), times = 10),         Precursor.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A2", "A3", "B2", "B3", "C1"), each = 4),         Protein.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A2", "A3", "B2", "B3", "C1"), each = 4),         Peptide.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A", "A", "B", "B", "C"), each = 4),         ProteinGroup.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A2", "A3", "B2", "B3", "C1"), each = 4)      )   ) ) )  # Result output <- get_ID_Report(   input_list = data )

title: Report about Missed Cleavages — get_MC_Report
text: Generates report information number missed cleavages

title: Report about Missed Cleavages — get_MC_Report
text: input_list list data frames respective missed cleavage information. metric "absolute" absolute numbers "percentage" displaying percentages. Default absolute.

title: Report about Missed Cleavages — get_MC_Report
text: function returns list. analysis respective data frame including information missed cleavages stored generated list. Analysis - analysis name. Missed.Cleavage - categorical entry number missed cleavages. mc_count - number missed cleavages per categorical missed cleavage entry - absolute percentage.

title: Report about Missed Cleavages — get_MC_Report
text: submitted data report generated information number missed cleavages.

title: Report about Missed Cleavages — get_MC_Report
text: Oliver Kardell

title: Report about Missed Cleavages — get_MC_Report
code: # Load libraries library(tibble) library(magrittr) library(stringr)  # Example data data <- list( Spectronaut = list(   filename = "C",   software = "Spectronaut",   data = list(      "Spectronaut" = tibble::tibble(         Stripped.Sequence_mpwR = c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E"),         Missed.Cleavage_mpwR = c(0, 1, 1, 2, 2)      )   ) ) )  # Result output <- get_MC_Report(   input_list = data,   metric = "absolute" )

title: Summary report — get_summary_Report
text: Generates summary report

title: Summary report — get_summary_Report
text: input_list list data frames including ID, DC, MC, LFQ RT information. CV_RT_th_hold Numeric. User-specified threshold CV value retention time precision. Default 5. CV_LFQ_Pep_th_hold Numeric. User-specified threshold CV value quantitative precision. Default 20. CV_LFQ_PG_th_hold Numeric. User-specified threshold CV value quantitative precision. Default 20.

title: Summary report — get_summary_Report
text: function returns list. analysis respective data frame stored list following information: Analysis - analysis name. "Median ProteinGroup.IDs abs." - median number proteingroup identifications. "Median Protein.IDs abs." - median number protein identifications. "Median Peptide.IDs abs." - median number peptide identifications. "Median Precursor.IDs abs." - median number precursor identifications. "Full profile - Precursor.IDs abs." - number precursor identifications full profiles. "Full profile - Peptide.IDs abs." - number peptide identifications full profiles. "Full profile - Protein.IDs abs." - number protein identifications full profiles. "Full profile - ProteinGroup.IDs abs." - number proteingroup identifications full profiles. "Full profile - Precursor.IDs %" - number precursor identifications full profiles percentage. "Full profile - Peptide.IDs %" - number peptide identifications full profiles percentage. "Full profile - Protein.IDs %" - number protein identifications full profiles percentage. "Full profile - ProteinGroup.IDs %" - number proteinGroup identifications full profiles percentage. "Precursor.IDs abs. CV Retention time < X %" - number precursor identifications CV value retention time precision user-specified threshold X. "Proteingroup.IDs abs. CV LFQ < X %" - number proteingroup identifications CV value quantitative precision user-specified threshold X. "Peptide.IDs abs. CV LFQ < X %" - number peptide identifications CV value quantitative precision user-specified threshold X. "Peptide IDs zero missed cleavages abs." - number peptide identifications zero missed cleavages. "Peptide IDs zero missed cleavages %" - number peptide identifications zero missed cleavages percentage.

title: Summary report — get_summary_Report
text: submitted data summary report including information achieved identifications (ID), data completeness (DC), missed cleavages (MC), quantitative (LFQ) retention time (RT) precision generated.

title: Summary report — get_summary_Report
text: Oliver Kardell

title: Summary report — get_summary_Report
code: # Load libraries library(tibble)  # Example data data <- list( DIANN = list(  filename = "B",  software = "DIA-NN",  data = list(    "DIA-NN" = tibble::tibble(      "Run_mpwR" = c("R01", "R01", "R02", "R03", "R01"),      "Precursor.IDs_mpwR" = c("A1", "A1", "A1", "A1", "B2"),      "Retention.time_mpwR" = c(3, 3.5, 4, 5, 4),      "ProteinGroup_LFQ_mpwR" = c(3, 4, 5, 4, 4),      "Peptide.IDs_mpwR" = c("A", "A", "A", "A", "B"),      "Protein.IDs_mpwR" = c("A", "A", "A", "A", "B"),      "ProteinGroup.IDs_mpwR" = c("A", "A", "A", "A", "B"),      "Stripped.Sequence_mpwR" = c("ABCR", "AKCR", "ABKCK", "ARKAR", "ABCDR")    )  ) ) )  # Result output <- get_summary_Report(   input_list = data )

title: Generate Upset list — get_Upset_list
text: Generate list input Upset plot

title: Generate Upset list — get_Upset_list
code: get_Upset_list(   input_list,   level = c("Precursor.IDs", "Peptide.IDs", "Protein.IDs", "ProteinGroup.IDs"),   percentage_runs = 100,   flowTraceR = FALSE,   remove_traceR_unknownMods = FALSE )

title: Generate Upset list — get_Upset_list
text: input_list list data frames respective level information. level Character string. Choose "Precursor.IDs", "Peptide.IDs", "Protein.IDs", "ProteinGroup.IDs". Default "Precursor.IDs". percentage_runs Number. Percentage appearance runs. 100 means: Identification present 100% runs. Default 100. flowTraceR Logical. FALSE level conversion applied. Useful inter-software comparisons. Default FALSE. remove_traceR_unknownMods Logical. FALSE unknown Modifications filtered . applies flowTraceR set TRUE. Default FALSE.

title: Generate Upset list — get_Upset_list
text: function returns list analysis respective level information.

title: Generate Upset list — get_Upset_list
text: input generated Upset plotting either precursor-, peptide-, protein- proteingroup-level. inter-software comparisons flowTraceR integrated.

title: Generate Upset list — get_Upset_list
text: Oliver Kardell

title: Generate Upset list — get_Upset_list
code: # Load libraries library(tibble) library(magrittr) library(stringr)  # Example data data <- list( DIANN = list(  filename = "B",  software = "DIA-NN",  data = list(    "DIA-NN" = tibble::tibble(      Run_mpwR = rep(c("A","B"), times = 10),      Precursor.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A2", "A3", "B2", "B3", "C1"), each = 4),      Protein.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A2", "A3", "B2", "B3", "C1"), each = 4),      Peptide.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A", "A", "B", "B", "C"), each = 4),      ProteinGroup.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A2", "A3", "B2", "B3", "C1"), each = 4)    )  ) ), Spectronaut = list(  filename = "C",  software = "Spectronaut",  data = list(    "Spectronaut" = tibble::tibble(      Run_mpwR = rep(c("A","B"), times = 15),      Precursor.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A2", "A3", "B2", "B3", "C1"), each = 6),      Peptide.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A", "A", "B", "B", "C"), each = 6),      ProteinGroup.IDs_mpwR = rep(c("A2", "A3", "B2", "B3", "C1"), each = 6)    )  ) ) )  # Result output <- get_Upset_list(   input_list = data,   level = "Precursor.IDs" )

what: Load and Prepare the input data with experimental design file — load_experimental_design
title: Load and Prepare the input data with experimental design file — load_experimental_design
text: Based submitted experimental design file input data imported, renamed default filtering applied. experimental design template available write_experimental_design.

title: Load and Prepare the input data with experimental design file — load_experimental_design
Load and Prepare the input data with experimental design file — load_experimental_design
text: path Path folder experimental design file. Within exp_design.csv user needs specify analysis name, software path analysis folder. Also specific default suffixes required: MaxQuant: _evidence, _peptides, _proteinGroups; PD - R-friendly headers enabled: _PSMs, _Proteins, _PeptideGroups, _ProteinGroups; DIA-NN, Spectronaut Generic: _Report

title: Load and Prepare the input data with experimental design file — load_experimental_design
text: list - list entry filename software info well stored data.

title: Load and Prepare the input data with experimental design file — load_experimental_design
text: Function easily importing default software outputs preparing downstream analysis mpwR multiple analysis folders. default MaxQuant "Reverse", "Potential contaminants" "identified site" filtered . default PD "High" confidence identifications included Found Sample column(s) also "High" identifications. Contaminants filtered . default Spectronaut EG.Identified equals TRUE included.

title: Load and Prepare the input data with experimental design file — load_experimental_design
text: Oliver Kardell

title: Load and Prepare the input data with experimental design file — load_experimental_design
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ #get template with write_experimental_design and adjust inputs write_experimental_design("DIRECTORY_TO_FILE")  #load in data files <- load_experimental_design(path = "DIRECTORY_TO_FILE/your_exp_design.csv") } # }

title: Density plot — plot_CV_density
text: Plot cumulative density precision results

title: Density plot — plot_CV_density
text: input_list list data frames respective information quantitative retention time precision. xaxes_limit Numeric. Limit x-axes plot. cv_col Character string. Choose "RT", "Pep_quant", "PG_quant" corresponding precision category. Default  RT retention time precision. Pep_quant equals quantitative precision peptide-level. PG_quant equals quantitative precision proteingroup-level.

title: Density plot — plot_CV_density
text: function returns density plot.

title: Density plot — plot_CV_density
text: Quantitative retention time precision plotted cumulative density.

title: Density plot — plot_CV_density
text: Oliver Kardell

title: Density plot — plot_CV_density
code: # Load libraries library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(comprehenr) library(tibble)  # Example data set.seed(123) data <- list(   "A" = tibble::tibble(     Analysis_mpwR = rep("A", times = 10),     CV_Retention.time_mpwR = sample(1:20, 10),     CV_Peptide_LFQ_mpwR = sample(1:30, 10),     CV_ProteinGroup_LFQ_mpwR = sample(1:30, 10)),  "B" = tibble::tibble(      Analysis_mpwR = rep("B", times = 10),      CV_Retention.time_mpwR = sample(1:20, 10),      CV_Peptide_LFQ_mpwR = sample(1:30, 10),      CV_ProteinGroup_LFQ_mpwR = sample(1:30, 10)) )  # Plot plot_CV_density(   input_list = data,   cv_col = "Pep_quant" )

title: Upset Plot — plot_Upset
text: Plot intersections analyses different levels.

title: Upset Plot — plot_Upset
code: plot_Upset(   input_list,   label = c("Precursor.IDs", "Peptide.IDs", "Protein.IDs", "ProteinGroup.IDs"),   nr_intersections = 10,   highlight_overlap = FALSE )

title: Upset Plot — plot_Upset
text: input_list list data frames respective level information. label Character string. Choose "Precursor.IDs", "Peptide.IDs", "Protein.IDs" "ProteinGroup.IDs" corresponding level. Default "Precursor.IDs". nr_intersections Numeric. Maximum number intersections shown plot. Default 10. highlight_overlap Logical. TRUE, overlapping intersections highlighted yellow. Default FALSE. TRUE, overlapping intersections need plot!

title: Upset Plot — plot_Upset
text: function returns Upset plot.

title: Upset Plot — plot_Upset
text: Identifications per level analysis compared possible intersections visualized.

what: Load and Prepare the input data — prepare_mpwR
title: Load and Prepare the input data — prepare_mpwR
text: Input data imported, renamed default filtering applied

title: Load and Prepare the input data — prepare_mpwR
Load and Prepare the input data — prepare_mpwR
text: path Path folder input data stored - input data. subfolders files. Analysis name prefix + MaxQuant: _evidence, _peptides, _proteinGroups; PD - R-friendly headers enabled: _PSMs, _Proteins, _PeptideGroups, _ProteinGroups; DIA-NN, Spectronaut Generic: _Report diann_addon_pg_qval Numeric 0 1. Applied DIA-NN data: diann_addon_pg_qval <= PG.Q.Value. diann_addon_prec_qval Numeric 0 1. Applied DIA-NN data: diann_addon_prec_qval <= Q.Value.

title: Load and Prepare the input data — prepare_mpwR
text: list - list entry filename software info well stored data.

title: Load and Prepare the input data — prepare_mpwR
text: Function easily importing default software outputs preparing downstream analysis mpwR within one folder. default MaxQuant "Reverse", "Potential contaminants" "identified site" filtered . default PD "High" confidence identifications included Found Sample column(s) also "High" identifications. Contaminants filtered . default Spectronaut EG.Identified equals TRUE included.

text: Oliver Kardell

what: Create template for experimental design — write_experimental_design
title: Create template for experimental design — write_experimental_design
text: Generation exp_design.csv file using import option load_experimental_design.

title: Create template for experimental design — write_experimental_design
Create template for experimental design — write_experimental_design
text: path Path folder exp_design file generated.

title: Create template for experimental design — write_experimental_design
text: function returns csv-file following columns: analysis_name - name analysis. software - name used software: DIA-NN, MaxQuant, PD, Spectronaut, Generic. path_to_folder - path analysis folder.

title: Create template for experimental design — write_experimental_design
text: generated exp_design.csv file can used starting point importing load_experimental_design option mpwR. Example entries provided. template file - exp_design.csv - generated specified path.

title: Create template for experimental design — write_experimental_design
text: Oliver Kardell

title: Create template for experimental design — write_experimental_design
Create generic template — write_generic_template
text: Generation template.csv file generic input data. template provided long-format.

title: Create generic template — write_generic_template
text: path_filename Path folder template generated user-defined filename

title: Create generic template — write_generic_template
text: function returns csv-file following columns: Run_mpwR - name file(s). ProteinGroup.IDs_mpwR - ProteinGroup identifier(s) protein(s) contained protein group. Protein.IDs_mpwR - Protein identifier(s). Peptide.IDs_mpwR - Sequence representation plus possible post-translational modifications. Precursor.IDs_mpwR - Sequence representation plus possible post-translational modifications including charge state. Stripped.Sequence_mpwR - 	amino acid sequence identified peptide without modifications. Precursor.Charge_mpwR - Charge state precursor. Missed.Cleavage_mpwR - Number missed enzymatic cleavages. Retention.time_mpwR -  Retention time minutes elution profile precursor ion. ProteinGroup_LFQ_mpwR - LFQ intensity column proteingroup-level Peptide_LFQ_mpwR - LFQ intensity column petide-level

title: Create generic template — write_generic_template
text: generated template.csv file can used create software-independent input file mpwR. Example entries provided. template file - filename_Report.csv - generated. appendix "_Report" required importing mpwR. Note template long-format, ProteinGroup.ID possible multiple entries depending number Precursor.IDs.

title: Create generic template — write_generic_template
text: Oliver Kardell

title: mpwR 0.1.5
text: CRAN release: 2023-11-13 Updated prepare_mpwR function - improvements MaxQuant import: Precursor Intensities 0 excluded Updated prepare_mpwR function - improvements DIA-NN import: Precursor.Quantity 0 excluded Updated prepare_mpwR function - improvements DIA-NN import: new parameter added filter specific PG.Q.Value Q.Value; default 1% (0.01)
